intro: Nunnezharia formosa, commonly known as the Hawaiian fernbush, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to the unique environmental conditions of Hawaii. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often with a hairy texture. Nunnezharia formosa plays an important role in the local ecosystem, providing habitat and nectar for native pollinators.
